title: Course on Enhancing Language Education Leadership and Academic Integrity in Digital Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency, secondary education experience, and understanding of foundational language education theories (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension instruction methods)
context.additional_context: Targets learners serving as language education managers/leaders within corporations, focusing on developing competencies that integrate language education leadership and academic integrity in digital environments. Includes business communication, job-related language proficiency enhancement, and effective language education strategy development in multicultural settings.

learning_goals: Implementation of at least three engagement strategies for language learners in digital environments (e.g., vocabulary quizzes, role-play simulations, discussion forums) through game-based learning design.

Identification of academic integrity issues (e.g., plagiarism, unfair collaboration task distribution) in online learning environments and establishment of prevention strategies tailored to language learning contexts (e.g., citation education, individual contribution assessment).
Cultivation of a collaborative knowledge co-construction culture (e.g., wiki-based glossary creation, peer review systems) using collaboration tools and social media.
Development and presentation of language education leadership action plans based on digital innovation trends (e.g., AI-driven personalized feedback, metaverse classroom design).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
